acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped byte values with @PodamByteValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleByteValuesWithThePodamByteValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.ByteValuePojo

Then the Object ByteRangeValuesPojo ( byteFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 29 byteFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 17 byteObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 95 byteObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 80 byteFieldWithPreciseValue = 12 ) should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the byte value 29 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the byte value 17 should be between 0 and 100
Then the Object 0 should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the Object 29 should not be null
Then the byte value 95 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the Object 80 should not be null
Then the byte value 80 should be between 0 and 100
The byte value 12 should be precisely 12
